Package: org.grails.datastore.mapping.simpledb.util

[Java] Interface SimpleDBTemplate

  • AWS SimpleDB template. This is a low-level way of accessing SimpleDB, currently is uses AWS SDK API as the return and parameter types.

    Authors:
    Roman Stepanenko
    Since:
    0.1

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Name and description
        void createDomain(java.lang.String domainName)
        boolean deleteAllItems(java.lang.String domainName)
        Returns true if any item was deleted, in other words if domain was empty it returns false.
        void deleteAttributes(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Attribute> attributes)
        If attributes is empty this method will do nothing - otherwise the whole item will be deleted.
        void deleteAttributesVersioned(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Attribute> attributes, java.lang.String expectedVersion, org.grails.datastore.mapping.model.PersistentEntity persistentEntity)
        Deletes attributes conditioned on the specified version - used for optimistic locking.
        void deleteDomain(java.lang.String domainName)
        void deleteItem(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id)
        Deletes the specified item with all of its attributes.
        com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Item get(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id)
        com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Item getConsistent(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id)
        Same as get but with consistent read flag.
        java.util.List<java.lang.String> listDomains()
        void putAttributes(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.ReplaceableAttribute> attributes)

        Puts attributes conditioned on the specified version - used for optimistic locking.

    • Method Detail

      • public void createDomain(java.lang.String domainName)

      • public boolean deleteAllItems(java.lang.String domainName)

        Returns true if any item was deleted, in other words if domain was empty it returns false.

        Parameters:
        domainName
        Returns:
        @throws DataAccessException

      • public void deleteAttributes(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Attribute> attributes)

        If attributes is empty this method will do nothing - otherwise the whole item will be deleted. Use dedicated deleteItem method to delete item.

        throws:
        DataAccessException
        Parameters:
        domainName
        id
        attributes

      • public void deleteAttributesVersioned(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Attribute> attributes, java.lang.String expectedVersion, org.grails.datastore.mapping.model.PersistentEntity persistentEntity)

        Deletes attributes conditioned on the specified version - used for optimistic locking. If the specified expectedVersion does not match what is in simpleDB, exception is thrown and no changes are made to the simpleDB. If attributes is empty this method will do nothing - otherwise the whole item will be deleted. Use dedicated deleteItem method to delete item.

        throws:
        DataAccessException
        Parameters:
        domainName
        id
        attributes
        expectedVersion
        persistentEntity

      • public void deleteDomain(java.lang.String domainName)

      • public void deleteItem(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id)

        Deletes the specified item with all of its attributes.

        Parameters:

        id

      • public com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Item getConsistent(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id)

        Same as get but with consistent read flag.

        Parameters:
        domainName
        id
        Returns:
        @throws DataAccessException

      • public java.util.List<java.lang.String> listDomains()

      • public void putAttributes(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.ReplaceableAttribute> attributes)

      • public void putAttributesVersioned(java.lang.String domainName, java.lang.String id, java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.ReplaceableAttribute> attributes, java.lang.String expectedVersion, org.grails.datastore.mapping.model.PersistentEntity persistentEntity)

        Puts attributes conditioned on the specified version - used for optimistic locking. If the specified expectedVersion does not match what is in simpleDB, exception is thrown and no changes are made to the simpleDB

        throws:
        DataAccessException
        Parameters:
        domainName
        id
        attributes
        expectedVersion
        persistentEntity

      • public java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.simpledb.model.Item> query(java.lang.String query, int max)

        Parameters:
        query
        max - maximum amount of items to return (inclusive). Note that this max parameter is very different from LIMIT parameter used in the actual query: LIMIT controls pretty much 'page size' while this parameter control total number of items returned.
        Returns:
        @throws DataAccessException
